Body:
I am following the tutorial - https://www.rabbitmq.com/tutorials/tutorial-one-dotnet.html

It gives the code for device as

using System;	using RabbitMQ.Client;	using System.Text;		class Send	{	     public static void Main()	    {    	        var factory = new ConnectionFactory() { HostName = "localhost" };	        using(var connection = factory.CreateConnection())	        using(var channel = connection.CreateModel())	        {	            channel.QueueDeclare(queue: "hello"
column12: arguments: null);		            string message = "Hello World!";	            var body = Encoding.UTF8.GetBytes(message);		            channel.BasicPublish(exchange: ""
column16:
message); } Console.WriteLine(" Press [enter] to exit."); Console.ReadLine(); } }

And the Receiver as 

using RabbitMQ.Client;	using RabbitMQ.Client.Events;	using System;	using System.Text;		class Receive	 {	     public static void Main()	     {	        var factory = new ConnectionFactory() { HostName = "localhost" };	        using(var connection = factory.CreateConnection())	        using(var channel = connection.CreateModel())	        {	            channel.QueueDeclare(queue: "hello"
column20: arguments: null);		            var consumer = new EventingBasicConsumer(channel);	            consumer.Received += (model
column21: ea) =>	            {	                var body = ea.Body;	                var message = Encoding.UTF8.GetString(body);	                Console.WriteLine(" [x] Received {0}"
column24:
consumer: consumer); Console.WriteLine(" Press [enter] to exit."); Console.ReadLine(); } } }

This sends the message from one terminal on my pc to the other terminal. But I want to send and store the messages to my SQL server. What all things I have to do for that. P.S. I am not much of a developer so you have to elaborate your answer
